titles.title: A joint resolution providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by Centers for Disease Control and Prevention relating to "Requirement for Persons To Wear Masks While on Conveyances and at Transportation Hubs".

A joint resolution providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by Centers for Disease Control and Prevention relating to "Requirement for Persons To Wear Masks While on Conveyances and at Transportation Hubs".

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.
Senate Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions discharged, by petition, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. 802(c).

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 305.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 57 - 40. Record Vote Number: 81.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

term.name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
Department of Health and Human Services
Emergency medical services and trauma care

bill.summary: This joint resolution nullifies the rule issued by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention on February 3, 2021, that requires the use of face masks on planes, trains, buses, and other public conveyances and at transportation hubs to prevent the transmission of COVID-19.
